UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Single amino acid substitutions at specific positions of the heptad repeat sequence of piscidin-1 yielded novel analogs that show low cytotoxicity as well as in vitro and in vivo anti-endotoxin activity.
Literature.Author: Kumar A, Tripathi AK, Kathuria M, Shree S, Tripathi JK, Purshottam RK, Ramachandran R, Mitra K, Ghosh JK

Literature.Title: Substitution of lysine for isoleucine at the center of the nonpolar face of the antimicrobial peptide, piscidin-1, leads to an increase in the rapidity of bactericidal activity and a reduction in toxicity.
Literature.Author: Taheri B, Mohammadi M, Momenzadeh N, Farshadzadeh Z, Roozbehani M, Dehghani P, Hajian S, Darvishi S, Shamseddin J

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:50% Hemolysis=150 µM,Human erythrocytes:50% Hemolysis=6.25 µg/ml,Human erythrocytes:100% Hemolysis=50 µg/ml,Human embryonic kidney HEK293 cells:>90% Killing=50 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=5.0±0.7µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=20±2.5µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=2.5±0.4µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=18±2.0µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC BAA-427(MIC=10.0±1.4µM),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 27736(MIC=6.0±0.8µM),Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633(MIC=8.0±1.1µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 10662(MIC=25µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=3.1µg/ml),Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 1435(MIC=1.5µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii(MIC=3.1µg/ml)
